fields.about: Scroll right and see Saarang Logo.
fields.name: Nature and Environment Quiz

fields.about:
Come discover India with us at the Saarang India Quiz.

A comprehensive test on everything India, from Aryabhata to Zenana, we've got Rajinikanth and Rasgullas and everything in between! Mind it!

Put on your thinking turbans, and take part in this exhilarating journey across the warp and weft of this beautiful ancient, dynamic, definition defying, enigmatic  land we call home.

No prior quizzing experience necessary. Jugaad out the answer with fundaes on screen.

Experience quizzing, IITM style.

Ekdum A-1 Quiz you will never forget!
fields.name: India Quiz
fields.registration_info:
No pre-registration required. Simply turn up for the event and enjoy yourself!

Unless you absolutely must register. In which case just email Anand.
fields.event_format:
Written prelims. 50 questions. Rock, Paper, Scissors to break ties.

The top 8 teams from the prelims will qualify for the finals.
fields.FAQs:
1. Do we have to pre-register?

Registrations on the spot! Pen is mandatory. Elephant optional. 

2. Are there any prerequisites?

An open mind and lots of enthu required. Basic general knowledge and ability to put n-pseud may come in handy. 

3. What kind of questions can we expect?

All kinds of questions! There are fun visual connects, buzzer rounds,  and a whole array of new theme rounds. Go through teaser Questions on the IIT Madras Quiz Club facebook page.

4. I don't know much about India. I'm a General Quizzer. Should I take part?

Absolutely. There is a little bit of India in everything. We will try our best to nudge you gently to discover facts about India you probably didn't know before.

5. Forever Alone. May I take part?

D'oh Totally! On the spot swayamwar for those needing partners or pens. Anti-social? Akeyla also okay!

6. Wait a minute. I was at Litsoc India. How long will the finals be?

It will be a very long quiz. Length ofcourse doesn't matter does it. It's what you do with it. Saarang India Quiz endeavours to be a comprehensive test of knowledge.

7. Will you ask Tam-max Questions?

Ans 1: (tamizhaaa?) Absolutely machi!

Ans 2: (Chapatti? Rotti? Butter Nan? Parotta even) No No ofcourse naat. India Quiz believes in Unity in Diversity. It will be a well balanced quiz about everything India. A little bit for everybody. Bollywood or Bhojpuri.    

8. What is the age difference between Vikram and Anand?

5 years

9. Is Vikram Venkat single?

The question on everyone's lips.
fields.prizes:
Cash Prizes:

1st prize: Rs 4500/-

2nd prize: Rs 3000/-

3rd prize: Rs 1500/-

Audience Prizes:

Exotic Chocolates or Cadbury DairyMilk (depending on budget) for

Most Postmodern Desi Team name
Most Pseud Answer 1 2 3
Most Paavum quizzer
Most Outraged junta 1 2 3
'Q Mukilan' Prize for Most musical answer
Best Pun
Most desi dressed
Best Arnab Goswami impression
Best usage of 'Thirukural quote' while putting funda.

fields.about:
Saarang Lectures and Demonstrations is back with distinguished speakers from various walks of life. Adding to the hues of Saarang, we  have a galaxy of celebrities who can inspire you with their intellectual and cultural acumen. Lend you ears to the riveting lectures by remarkable personalities from Cinema, Literature, Arts and Civil Society.

Saarang Demonstrations bring you astonishing performances by highly acclaimed artists. Get ready to witness the entralling performances this Saarang 2014.
fields.name: Lectures and Demonstrations
fields.FAQs:
Do I need to register for the event?

No. Entry to the lecture hall is based on first come first serve basis. 

 

What are the timings for the lectures?

Timings will be released soon. Stay tuned to the Saarang website and the Saarang facebook page for exact timings.

 

What is the venue for the lectures?

The lectures will be helf at IC&SR main auditorium.

 

Do I have to pay for attending the lecture?

No. Saarang's vision is to provide a platform to listen to intellectuals is open to all.

fields.about: Wondering if playing on the same stage as A. R. Rahman, Zakir Hussain, Shivamani, Udaan , Anirudh Ravichander,Karthik and Aalap Raju is impossible, then Tarang is what you're looking for. Over the years, Tarang has evolved into one of the best events at Saarang with the best bands participating from all across the country. Come, be part of this awesome experience and get a chance to perform to a packed crowd and judged by the best judges. On top of that, there is always the prize money and other irresistible opportunities you simply can’t miss!
fields.name: Tarang
fields.registration_info:
TARANG: Pre-registration Rules

A audio-video recording has to be made and uploaded on any video sharing site (preferably youtube) and the link has to be sent to us at lm@saarang.org with the subject “Tarang 2014 Online Round”. The mail should include the following:

  • Name of the band, names of band members , their contact details ( phone numbers, e-mail id’s), and a band group photo .
  • A band email id (this will be the id to which all future correspondence will be directed).
  • No other band member (other than the ones mentioned in the mail) will be allowed to participate.
  •  The number of band members should not differ from that in the video.
  • Kindly use only one thread to discuss any issues related to Pre-registration procedure.
  • Winners from Saarang band hunt need not Pre-Register. They can directly participate in Prelims. But its compulsory to inform the event coordinators about your presence at Tarang 2014.

 

In case of any deviation the event coordinators are to be informed accordingly.

 

  • The video should clearly show all the playing band members.
  • Duration of the video should not exceed 5 mins.
  • The video should be complete, i.e. the performance should not be cut abruptly. The quality of the audio is very crucial and is left as the band’s responsibility. Videos with bad audio quality will not be judged.
  • The video must not be edited and must be original. In case of any discrepancy, the band will be disqualified.
  • The bands will be selected on the basis of the video sent by them.
  • The selected bands will be notified in due time. It’ll also be put up in the website.

 

 In case of any discrepancy the event coordinator’s decision would be final and binding.
fields.event_format:
TARANG : Event Format and Rules

  • Light music band event for student bands.
  • Performances should be in Indian languages only.
  • It’s a 3 tier competition – Prelims, Semis and Finals.
  • 1 own composition is compulsory for semis and finals. Credit will also be given to the versatility in the genres of the songs performed.
  • The time given per band- 10mins+ 2mins (15+2 for the Finals). This includes the time taken for sound-check and the performance. Strictly no extra time would be given on stage; all the tuning and bending of instruments should be done before handed.
  • Band should consist of a minimum of 4 members. A maximum number of 12 members are allowed in a band. At a time only 8 members would be allowed to perform on stage.
  • Bands should contain at least one Instrumentalist. Acapella is not allowed.
  • No restriction on the number of and type of musical instruments the bands may bring. A standard 5 piece drum kit, a keyboard stand and microphones will be provided on stage.
  • A valid id card (college-issued) has to be provided compulsorily for every band member. A Saarang ID is mandatory for anyone to participate in this event.
  • NO Member of one band will be allowed to play with any other band participating in Tarang.

 

 

In case of any discrepancy, the event organiser’s OR the judge’s decision would be final and binding.

fields.about:
We invite you to Panache- The Fashion Fiesta at Saarang 2014!

 

Do you sometimes wish you could dress the world and make them look fashionable? Do you think you have an unmatched sense of style and panache? Then come this Saarang, and show everyone your very own to-die-for creations! Think out-of-the-box, get high on creativity and fascinate your audience with your oomph factor.

 

Prize money and lots of exciting vouchers to be won!  

 

Contact:

Smita Mujumdar (+91 8939 570 987)

Rituja Saha (+91 9840 083 395)

Ankit Jain (+91 9043 807 215)

 

Email - panache@saarang.org
fields.name: Panache
fields.registration_info:
Registration begins - with website launch

 

Last date for registration: 2nd December, 2013

 

Last date for submission for elimination round: 15th December, 2013
fields.event_format:
Structure:

The competition would comprise of an elimination round and two stage rounds. Both the stage rounds will be theme based wherein the teams have to design their costumes/outfits according to the common theme.

 

Elimination Procedure:

The designers will have to mail a soft copy of their designs for the stage rounds along with the portfolios [with photo ID] of all the models walking the ramp to panache@saarang.org. The elimination round would be based on this. It is to be noted that the design submitted during this round would only be allowed for the stage rounds. Thus, the designs for both the rounds have to be sent.
fields.FAQs:
Rules and Regulations:

 

1. Panache is open to college students only.

 

2. There can be more than one team from a respective college or even crossover teams can be formed.

 

3. All the members of a team must have a valid college ID card.

 

4. Vulgarity of any kind would lead to disqualification of the team. It is strongly advised

that the team consult the organizers if the team feels that any stunt or costume design can be deemed as vulgar. The decision of the organizers would be final in any kind of resulting dispute.

 

5. Team Size: Maximum 15 members; models - 8-10, designers - 1-4.

 

6. Every team is required to represent all body types in their designs and presentation.

 

7. Stage time: 6+2 minutes; empty stage to empty stage. Each team is responsible for clearing the stage once their performance is over. At the end of all performances, each team will be given 3-5 minutes to interact with judges.

 

8. Teams are to inform the organizers of any kind of props they plan to use during the event. Use of water, fire, pets, animal skin or any hazardous materials are not allowed. Teams are instructed to consult with the organizers before using any such material.

 

9. Teams are instructed to send in their song tracks/music ten days prior to the event.

 

10. Any lighting requirements are to be informed at least two weeks before the event, any last minute requirements will not be entertained.

 

11. There must no branding on clothes.

 

12. The decision of the judges will be final and cannot be questioned.

fields.name: PotPourrie
fields.prizes: Not yet finalised. Tentatively 3k, 2k, 1k for third, second, first.

fields.about:
Get tips and Exercises to Sharpen Your Mind and Boost Brainpower. Chances are high,that you're fully aware of the number-placement logic game Sudoku which is massively popular. But if you've been in a cave the past few years and need evidence, look no further than saarang SUDOKU Championship, one of the biggest crowd catching event.

NO age limit.
NO prerequisite.
Full of fun.

Just walk in, play with numbers. And you can make easy cash.
fields.name: Sudoku
fields.event_format:
1. Only individual participation.
  2. From each prelim, top 20 participants will be selected for the finals
  3. Prelims will be for 1.5 hours and finals for 2 hours.
  4. Coordinators decision will be final and binding to all.
fields.FAQs:
Q. Do I need to bring pen?

A. Yes. But if you forget, needn't worry we will provide.

Q. Can I bring paper?

A. No. Papers are not allowed

Q. Do I have to know about any special type of Sudoku or puzzle?

A. No. No pre-requisites. Instructions will be given be given in the paper.

fields.about:
"A picture can tell a thousand words, but a few words can change its story."

If you can move crowds like Mark Antony or amuse them like Russell Peters, all you need to do is grab the Saarang mike! Enthrall the audience, make them speechless and nothing can be an obstacle between you and glory. An individual event, thou shall be thy only company!
fields.name: Elocution

fields.about: Want to send a message through your acting? Saarang gives you the audience of your dreams, as you perform to an enormous floating crowd, and take back prizes for making a change. Start that wave! Come do a street play at Saarang.
fields.name: Street Play
fields.registration_info: Registration is on a first-come first-served basis the day before the event at the Hospitality Desk.
fields.event_format:
• Time Limit – 15 minutes
  • Only acoustic and percussion instruments will be allowed.
  • Plays will have to deal with subjects of social relevance. There is however no specific theme.
  • Plays in English, Tamil and Hindi are allowed. Please avoid other languages except for very small lines.
  • No props/costume will be provided.
  • Please stick to the area allotted to the event.
  • Registration is on a first-come first-served basis the day before the event at the Hospitality Desk.
fields.FAQs:
1. Is it a pre-registered event?

No, it is not. However registrations will be held on a first-come first-served basis the day before the event at the Hospitality Desk.

2. Are the participants confined to a particular language to express themselves in play?

Plays in English, Tamil and Hindi are allowed. But please avoid any other language except for a few lines.

3. Should the plays have a socially relevant theme?

Yes, the plays will have to deal with subjects of social relevance. However there is no specific theme.

4. Will basic props and costumes be provided?

No props/costumes will be provided.

fields.about:
“Movies will make you famous; Television will make you rich; But theatre will make you good.”

-Terrence Mann

Nuff said? We don’t think so! This year prepare yourself to tear up, sniffle, and laugh out loud as Saarang Dramatics returns. 

The stage is set. We just have to turn the lights on.
fields.name: Dramatics
fields.event_format:
• Teams can be of any size.
  • Participants will have to carry ID cards to register.
  • There will be two rounds of shortlisting.
  • The first round is done based on the script.  Send us your script by the 15th of December.
  • The second round involves putting up a 6 minute sketch of your play in front of a panel of judges at Saarang 2014.
  • Teams in the final shortlist will showcase their play in CLT, IIT Madras at Saarang 2014. Please read on for the rules regarding the final round.
  • Time Limit - Time of 45<can be subject to change> minutes will be counted from 'empty stage to empty stage'.
  • Use of basic props is encouraged. We will provide basic props like chairs and tables if informed in advance.
  • Sticking on the backdrop will NOT be allowed.
  • Use of fire/water/smoke machines on stage (or anywhere in its vicinity) is strictly prohibited. Smoking on stage is prohibited.
  • Lights will be provided. No extra lights will be allowed.
  • Sounds - Bring your own laptop with the sounds. Live music is allowed. In the event that the team is playing live, they must bring their own instruments.
  • The play should primarily be in English. Excessive profanities are discouraged.

Disclaimer: Rules are subject to change without prior notice. Teams will be informed of the changes.

fields.about: If acting to you just means bringing out the characters to their lives and swooning the audience off its feet, then stay away from Mad-Ads. As the name suggests, here you get points for acting retarded and of course, for Out of the Box Ideas! They can be anything – Baba Ramdev doing a jingle to advertise body lotion or Manmohan Singh smiling even during corruption. (That’s not exactly Out of the Box, but you get the point!) So if you have wit and a taste for smart humour, make sure you’re there.
fields.name: Mad-Ads
fields.event_format:
• Teams consisting of a maximum of 7 members
  • Time on stage: 6+1 minutes. After 6 minutes, a buzzer/bell will be rung
  • Teams are allowed to use minimalistic props and costumes. But they will have to be brought by the team. Basic props will be provided. (3 chairs and 1 table)
  • Participants have to be students of a college, and should carry a valid ID card.
  • The pieces should primarily be in English.
fields.FAQs:
1. How do you register for the event?

It's an Onsite registration event. Make sure you're there!

2. Is there any restriction on the number of entries/teams per college?

No, there is no restriction on the number of teams per college.

3. Can a team have students from different colleges?

Yes, a team can comprise of students from different colleges. But they should all carry with themselves a valid ID card indicating that they belong to a particular college.

4. Are the teams allowed to use props and costumes for Mad-Ads? Will basic props be provided by the organizers?

Yes, the teams are allowed to use props and costumes for Mad-Ads. However it is recommended to go with minimalistic props, as per the concept of this event. Basic props (3 Chair and 1 Table) will be provided by the coordinators.

fields.about:
Make a mark this Saarang at one of the biggest college band competitions in the

country. Fame, glory, fans, and most importantly a celebration of your music - watch it

all work on your accord at Powerchords. It's your turn to strike a chord.
fields.name: Powerchords
fields.registration_info: Participants will have to register through the saarang website. An online preliminary round will take place, with 18 bands coming to play at Saarang 2014
fields.event_format:
1. Online registration from which 18 bands are selected.
2. On Day1 all 18 bands compete, each band gets 15 minutes.
3. 6 of these bands are shortlisted to compete on Day2. Each gets 20 minutes.
fields.FAQs:
1. Will transportation and accomodation be provided to participants? 
Participants requiring accomodation will have to mention this while registering online. You will be put up in hostels inside the campus. Transportation however will not be provided. 

2. Will instruments be provided? 
While we will be providing all sound system requirements (amplifiers, mics, 5 piece drum kit, audio cables) participants will have to bring their own instruments.

3. When do we have to reach IITM? 
Participants have to ensure that they reach IITM by 9am. However for it is recommended that you come on Day 1 itself for a wholesome Saarang experience. 

4. Do we need to get our college ids? 
Yes. Valid college ids are mandatory for all events except Decibels. Also, all participants must be 25 years of age or below.

 5. Can a participant be a part of more than one band in the same event? 
No. Participants are allowed to represent only one band per event

fields.about:
“If you can't play it on an acoustic guitar or a grand piano then it's not a song.”

No Distortions, No Electronic Noises, only raw and gentle combination of plain old strings and percussion. LM Unplugged is the platform to show the world the 'Acoustic-ity' of your band and be judged by the masters. Above all, cash prizes and lots of goodies waiting to be grabbed
fields.name: Unplugged
fields.registration_info:
Registrations for this event will be done in 2 ways both – on-site and pre-registered, each having 50% quota of the total number of participants. On-site Registrations for the event will start at the Hospitality Desk One Hour prior to the beginning of the event. This will be strictly on first-come-first-served basis.

Pre-registration Rules-

A audio-video recording has to be made and uploaded on any video sharing site (preferably youtube) and the link has to be sent to us at lm@saarang.org with the subject “Unplugged 2014 Online Round”. The mail should include the following:

  • Name of the band, names of band members , their contact details ( phone numbers, e-mail id’s), and a band group photo.
  • A band email id (this will be the id to which all future correspondence will be directed).
  • No other band member (other than the ones mentioned in the mail) will be allowed to participate.
  • The number of band members should not differ from that in the video.
  • Kindly use only one thread to discuss any issues related to Pre-registration procedure.

 

In case of any deviation the event coordinators are to be informed accordingly.

 

  • The video should clearly show all the playing band members.
  • Duration of the video should not exceed 5 mins.
  • The video should be complete, i.e. the performance should not be cut abruptly. The quality of the audio is very crucial and is left as the band’s responsibility. Videos with bad audio quality will not be judged.
  • The video must not be edited and must be original. In case of any discrepancy, the band will be disqualified.
  • The bands will be selected on the basis of the video sent by them.
  • The selected bands will be notified in due time. It’ll also be put up in the website.
  • The bands will be selected in the basis of the video sent by them. Keep in mind Acoustic instruments only.

 

 In case of any discrepancy the event coordinator’s decision would be final and binding.
fields.event_format:
LM Unplugged -Event Format and Rules

  • Light music acoustic band event.
  • It is a Single round competition.
  • Performances should be in Indian languages only (a refrain/rap in English can be used).
  • The time given per band- 10 mins+ 2 mins.
  • Strictly no extra time would be given on stage; all the tuning and bending of instruments should be done before handed.
  • The band should consist of a minimum of 3 members.
  • The maximum number of people allowed in a band is 10.
  • Electric guitar, pedals, processors, or percussion are not allowed.
  • Bass guitars without processor can be used.
  • Keyboards can be used in piano patch only. No layering or splitting of keyboard is allowed.
  • A drum kit (5 piece with 4 cymbals), a keyboard stand, and microphones will be provided on stage.
  • Pure instrumental pieces are not allowed, a minimum of one vocalist is compulsory. Atleast 2 different instruments must be used in any case.
  • A valid id card (college-issued) has to be provided compulsorily for every band member. A Saarang ID is mandatory for anyone to participate in this event.
  • NO Member of one band will be allowed to play with any other band participating in Unplugged.
  • In case of any discrepancy the event organiser’s OR judge’s decision would be final and binding.

fields.about:
Longing for a platform to showcase your vocal skills, all solo? With more than a hundred participants to compete with, best judges to be judged by and the most awesome stage to perform on, Saarang LM Alankaar is the best place to be!

The spotlight will be on you and you only. . .
fields.name: Alankar
fields.registration_info: Onsite Registration at Hospitality Desk, 1 hour prior to the event.
fields.event_format:
Event Format and Rules

Prelims:-

  • Light music solo vocals event.
  • This is an open event for all college students.
  • Performances should be in Indian languages only. Presence of considerable foreign language might lead to disqualification, based on the judge’s discretion.
  • Contestants will be registered on the spot. A Saarang ID is a MUST for anyone to participate in this event. Only registered participants will be allowed to perform. Registrations will start at the hospitality desk ONE HOUR prior to the beginning of the event. A valid college ID card is necessary for registration.
  • Event would be organized in a three level fashion, i.e. prelims , semi- finals and finals.
  • Time given per contestant- 3:30 mins + 30 secs.
  • One accompaniment (instrument)/MIDI backing track, is allowed.
  • In case of the accompaniment being an MIDI track, it has to be submitted to the event coordinators before the event starts. Allowing of the MIDI track is up to the event coordinator’s discretion.
  • Strictly no extra time would be given on stage; all the tuning and bending of instruments should be done before handed.
  • Instruments will not be provided by us.
  • Metronome is not allowed.
  • Shruti box is permitted. You are expected to bring your own.
  • In case of any discrepancy the event organiser’s OR judge’s decision would be final and binding

 

.

Semi-Finals:-

 

  • ONLY 16-20 participants will be selected from the prelims for the semifinals.
  • Participant are allowed to sing the same song that they performed for the prelims.
  • Rest of the rules remain the same as that of prelims.

 

Finals:-

 

  • ONLY 8-10 participants will be selected.
  • The participant will be asked to prepare 3 types of Indian language songs, which will be intimated right after semi-finals.

fields.about:
Think it’s time for your band to be launched into the limelight? Think you have what it takes to

compete against some of the best bands in the country? Then waste no time and sign your band up

for Saarang Decibels 2014, one of India’s premier competitions for semi-professional bands to make

your claim to fame.
fields.name: Decibels
fields.registration_info: Registrations will happen on the nh7 portal. Bands are required to visit the page and send in samples of their music, on the basis if which the top 25, and eventually the final 12 will be picked.
fields.event_format:
1. Online registrations from which 25 bands are selected.
2. These bands are then put to public voting 
3.12 of these bands are selected to play at saarang.
4. Each band gets 22 minutes.
5. The top 2 bands get the chance to perform at OAT and open the rock show.
fields.FAQs:
1. Will transportation and accomodation be provided to participants? 
Participants requiring accomodation will have to mention this while registering online. You will be put up in hostels inside the campus. Transportation however will not be provided. 

2. Will instruments be provided? 
While we will be providing all sound system requirements (amplifiers, mics, 5 piece drum kit, audio cables), participants will have to bring their own instruments.

3. When do we have to reach IITM? 
Participants have to ensure that they reach IITM by 9am. However for it is recommended that you come on Day 1 itself for a wholesome Saarang experience. 

4. Do we need to get our college ids? 
  For this event, no college ids are required. Non-college participants are allowed to participate.

 5. Can a participant be a part of more than one band in the same event? 
No. Participants are allowed to represent only one band per event
fields.prizes:
Prize money:

1st: 80,000

2nd:50,000

3rd:20,000

 

The winners and the runners up play at OAT before the Rock Show, as an opening act.

 The winners are also covered as band of the month on Eight Octaves

fields.about:
Saarang gives you a platform to get out there and win hearts with your vocal talent. This solo

singing competition in 2 stages pushes you to discover the best in you.
fields.name: Vox
fields.registration_info: 25 slots are booked for online registrations. 15 slots will be open for on the spot.
fields.event_format:
1. 25 singers are enlisted through online registrations
2. 15 singers are enlisted on the spot.
3. All enlistments are done on first-come first-serve basis.
4. Each singer gets 5 min 30 sec
fields.FAQs:
FAQs
1. Will transportation and accomodation be provided to participants? 
Participants requiring accomodation will have to mention this while registering online. You will be put up in hostels inside the campus. Transportation however will not be provided. 

2. When do we have to reach IITM? 
Participants have to ensure that they reach IITM by 9am. However for it is recommended that you come on Day 1 itself for a wholesome Saarang experience. 

3. Do we need to get our college ids? 
Yes. Valid college ids are mandatory for all events except Decibels.

 4. Are sonata and vox participants allowed to use backing tracks?
Yes, participants of sonata and vox are allowed to use a backing track  or an accompanying instrument

fields.about:
Music needs no words. Let your instrument do the talking at Sonata, Saarang’s solo instrumental

event.
fields.name: Sonata
fields.FAQs:
1. Will transportation and accomodation be provided to participants? 
Participants requiring accomodation will have to mention this while registering online. You will be put up in hostels inside the campus. Transportation however will not be provided. 

2. Will instruments be provided? 
While we will be providing all sound system requirements (amplifiers, mics, 5 piece drum kit, audio cables) participants will have to bring their own instruments.

3. When do we have to reach IITM? 
Participants have to ensure that they reach IITM by 9am. However for it is recommended that you come on Day 1 itself for a wholesome Saarang experience. 

4. Do we need to get our college ids? 
Yes. Valid college ids are mandatory for all events except Decibels.

 5. Are sonata and vox participants allowed to use backing tracks?
Yes, participants of sonata and vox are allowed to use a backing track  or an accompanying instrument

fields.about:
These alliterative accomplices are all you need to set the stage on fire! Get the audience

plugged to sheer, sexy music with Acoustyx, Saarang's exclusive acoustic band

competition; or better - woo the crowd with the magic of pure vocals at our very own

Acappella singing event.
fields.name: Acoustyx/A capella
fields.event_format:
1. No processors/effects pedals are permitted.

2. Both Acoustyx and Acapella is open only to school and college bands. School/college IDs

WLL be asked for verification.

3. Acoustyx participants will be given 10 minutes on stage (includes any set-up time).

4. Acoustyx bands should have a minimum of two instrumentalists and a maximum of three

vocalists.

5. Acapella participants will be given 10 minutes on stage (includes any set-up time).

6. Songs must be predominantly in English. More importantly, western musical instruments

must be used. The extent to which these rules are imposed will be left up to the discretion

of the judges.
fields.FAQs:
1. Will transportation and accomodation be provided to participants? 
Participants requiring accomodation will have to mention this while registering online. You will be put up in hostels inside the campus. Transportation however will not be provided. 

2. Will instruments be provided? 
While we will be providing all sound system requirements (amplifiers, mics, 5 piece drum kit, audio cables) participants will have to bring their own instruments.

3. When do we have to reach IITM? 
Participants have to ensure that they reach IITM by 9am. However for it is recommended that you come on Day 1 itself for a wholesome Saarang experience. 

4. Do we need to get our college ids? 
Yes. Valid college ids are mandatory for all events except Decibels.

5.  Can a participant be a part of more than one band in the same event? 
No. Participants are allowed to represent only one band per event

fields.about:
Vocals, instruments, and some crazy energy. The only thing missing from Saarang was

some music to get the crowd grooving and partying. Here's your chance to pump up the

party with DJukebox - our all new and absolutely insane DJing event for school and

college DJs!
fields.name: Djukebox
fields.registration_info: Participants must register online on the saarang website. The first 16 to register will be selected to play at Saarang 2014
fields.event_format:
1. 16 DJs are enlisted through online registrations.
2. A total of 15 heats will be conducted. The event follows a knockout format, with face-offs between DJ's.
fields.FAQs:
1. Will transportation and accomodation be provided to participants? 
Participants requiring accomodation will have to mention this while registering online. You will be put up in hostels inside the campus. Transportation however will not be provided. 

2. Will equipment be provided? 
   Basic DJing equipment will be provided, but participants who wish to bring in their own gear are welcome to do so.

3. When do we have to reach IITM? 
Participants have to ensure that they reach IITM by 9am. However for it is recommended that you come on Day 1 itself for a wholesome Saarang experience. 

4. Do we need to get our college ids? 
Yes. Valid college ids are mandatory for all events except Decibels.

fields.about:
While you’re sitting alone on a bench by the edge of a pond, or when you’re sitting on the last bench

of your class looking at the graffiti on your desk, the thing in common is that your eyes are open but

they don’t see anything. While you gaze into that nothingness, your mind indulges itself into that

visual stream, floating, without complaining. It is through this poetic beauty of images that we’re

able to connect to each other in the ‘man-made’ art, cinema. That is what makes it natural; that is

the irony of it. How else would have Sam Mendes told us about the plastic cover that wanted to play

with Ricky, how else would we have known what Ben was feeling in the ‘Sound of Silence’? Here, at

Saarang, we wish to relive this dream again. And you are the creators of this dream world.

Let the magic happen!
fields.name: Short Film Making
fields.event_format:
Event Format and Rules:

1. There is no particular theme. Duration of the short films should neither be more than 15

minutes & nor be less than 5 minutes.

2. Films of all languages (including English) should be accompanied with English subtitles.

3. The participants will have to submit their entries by mailing their film’s link on YouTube or

any other web portal, to shortfilm@saarang.org

4. You may use any video camera you deem suitable for shooting the movie. However, we

strongly discourage low-resolution cameras, including webcams and mobile-phone cameras.

5. The shortlisted teams will be asked to come to Saarang where their films will be screened.

Accommodation will be provided for the shortlisted teams.

6. Obscenity (at the discretion of the judges) of any kind is not allowed and will lead

to immediate disqualification. Please avoid photo slideshows, remixes, spoofs and

advertisements. Plagiarism is strictly prohibited. Sound track can be borrowed, but with due

credit.

7. Time Limit should be followed. Participants will be heavily penalized by judges in case of

exceeding the time limit.

8. The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
fields.FAQs:
1. Is registration required for this event?

Yes!

2. How should we submit our entries?

Mail your short film’s YouTube link or any such web portal to shortfilm@saarang.org
